data.title: Michael B. Chang, M.D., FACMS, FAAD
data.meta_description: Michael B. Chang, M.D., FACMS, FAAD, is a board-certified dermatologist and fellowship-trained dermatologic surgeon.  He was born in Columbus, Ohio and grew up in the Washington, DC area.
data.meta_site_name: Dermatology and Skin Cancer Center of New Mexico
data.text:
Michael B. Chang, M.D., FACMS, FAAD, is a board-certified dermatologist and fellowship-trained dermatologic surgeon. He was born in Columbus, Ohio and grew up in the Washington, DC area. After graduating from Stanford University, Dr. Chang completed his medical training at the University of Maryland School of Medicine in Baltimore, Maryland. His post-graduate training included a residency in dermatology at Mayo Clinic in Rochester, Minnesota, followed by a fellowship in Micrographic Surgery and Dermatologic Oncology also at Mayo Clinic. Dr. Chang practices both general dermatology and Mohs surgery with a strong interest in prevention, early detection, and surgical treatment of all types of skin cancers. In his free time, he enjoys exploring New Mexico with his wife and young daughters, running, hiking, reading, and watching sports.

EDUCATION:

Internship: Preliminary Internal Medicine, Mercy Medical Center, Baltimore, Maryland

Residency: Dermatology, Mayo Clinic, Rochester, Minnesota

Fellowship: Micrographic Surgery and Dermatologic Oncology, Mayo Clinic, Rochester, Minnesota

RESEARCH INTERESTS

Squamous Cell Carcinomas of the Extremities

Hypertrophic Lichen Planus

Merkel Cell Carcinoma

PROFESSIONAL ORGANIZATIONS
